org.mfg.mdb.demo

Class Demo_02_PriceMDB.Appender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mfg.mdb.demo.Demo_02_PriceMDB.Appender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAppender<Demo_02_PriceMDB.Record>
    Enclosing class:
    Demo_02_PriceMDB

    public final class Demo_02_PriceMDB.Appender
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAppender<Demo_02_PriceMDB.Record>

    This is the class used to append records to an MDB file.

    The common way to use an appender is: 
     Appender ap = mdb.appender();
 while( ... ) {
        ap.time = getTime();    
        ap.price = getPrice();  
        ap.append();
 }
 ap.close();

      • append_ref_unsafe

        public void append_ref_unsafe(Demo_02_PriceMDB.Record record)
                       throws java.io.IOException

        Warning! Do not use this method if you don't know what are you doing!

        Append the record but not copy it. Use this method if you are fully sure that you will not touch that record instance again, else the data will be corrupted.

        Specified by:
        append_ref_unsafe in interface IAppender<Demo_02_PriceMDB.Record>
        Parameters:
        record - The record to append.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is any problem writing the file.
